Creating a makeshift shelter using natural resources: This idea involves building a shelter using materials such as branches, leaves, and vines. The shelter can be used to protect the person from the elements and provide a place to rest. Confidence score: 0.9

Starting a fire: This idea involves finding a source of firewood and starting a fire using a fire starter or other methods. Fire can be used to cook food, provide warmth, and signal for help. Confidence score: 0.7

Building a raft or boat: This idea involves building a raft or boat using natural materials such as wood, vines, and leaves. The raft or boat can be used to escape the island and seek help. Confidence score: 0.6

Building a signal: This idea involves building a signal using natural materials such as branches, rocks, and shells. The signal can be used to attract the attention of passing boats or airplanes. Confidence score: 0.5
